text:
Anybody else getting Error: internal error with Growth theme modules? When uploading a module with color options Iâ€™m getting the message: Color field at path hover.background.color has an invalid default value.

This has only recently started happening.

So... I could use some advice here... I am working on a custom theme, and I am trying to build a custom blog search results page. Because of how the theme is set up I should be able to use the accounts search results page and just add my new template with my variations of the search input module. However, I am struggling to figure out a way to test the new template... If I create a general site page to test it on I get no results pulling. Using the same input if I change the output location on the form `<form _action_="<https://www.golimelight.com/search-test>">` (that is the one for the test page I made, the default is: `<form _action_="/{{ site_settings.content_search_results_page_path }}">` back to the HubSpot default it shows just fine except it's on the old template. The current site uses the search so I can't just change the template in the settings yet.
Then you set the search results template to a template with just that ^
What does the `hsDebug` at the end of that variable call? I know what the rest does but I'm not familiar with that.
query_dict is an array with any query parameter. hsDebug could be anything
So then you would just add the `?hsDebug=True` onto your query string for the test template and if true it calls the v1 template and if false calls the v2 template
right, you're just using the `hsDebug` as an example query. I just need to set w/e query I am going to be using to test as that condition.
Yes. If the parameter exists render template v2. Otherwise just load v1
I use it a lot to test blogs too.
Now that the listing pages can be edited maybe you can get around using this on the blogs from now on. hopefully they'll add a simple way to test system pages soon.
This should work perfectly for what I need, thanks for the response!
